main event: A red object was sighted in the sky over Cleveland, Ohio on April 5, 1949.
interesting points: The object appeared as a bright red, stationary light that did not move for several minutes.
The object was estimated to be at an altitude of 12,000 feet and 6-10 miles from the observer.
Attempts were made to establish radio and visual contact with the object, but were unsuccessful.
The observers considered the possibility of it being a helicopter, balloon, aircraft, or celestial object, but could not definitively identify it.
The sighting occurred on a clear night with unrestricted visibility.
sighted object: A bright red, stationary light in the sky
witnesses: Air traffic control personnel at Cleveland Municipal Airport
